      18             : 
      19             : // The std library doesn't provide a binary max_exponent for integers, however
      20             : // we can compute one by adding one to the number of non-sign bits. This allows
      21             : // for accurate range comparisons between floating point and integer types.
      22             : template <typename NumericType>
      23             : struct MaxExponent
      24             : {
      25             :     static_assert(std::is_arithmetic<NumericType>::value, "Argument must be numeric.");
      26             :     static const int value =
      27             :         std::numeric_limits<NumericType>::is_iec559
      28             :             ? std::numeric_limits<NumericType>::max_exponent
      29             :             : (sizeof(NumericType) * CHAR_BIT + 1 - std::numeric_limits<NumericType>::is_signed);
      30             : };
      31             : 
      32             : enum IntegerRepresentation
      33             : {
      34             :     INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
      35             :     INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED
      36             : };
      37             : 
      38             : // A range for a given nunmeric Src type is contained for a given numeric Dst
      39             : // type if both numeric_limits<Src>::max() <= numeric_limits<Dst>::max() and
      40             : // numeric_limits<Src>::min() >= numeric_limits<Dst>::min() are true.
      41             : // We implement this as template specializations rather than simple static
      42             : // comparisons to ensure type correctness in our comparisons.
      43             : enum NumericRangeRepresentation
      44             : {
      45             :     NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED,
      46             :     NUMERIC_RANGE_CONTAINED
      47             : };
      48             : 
      49             : // Helper templates to statically determine if our destination type can contain
      50             : // maximum and minimum values represented by the source type.
      51             : 
      52             : template <typename Dst,
      53             :           typename Src,
      54             :           IntegerRepresentation DstSign = std::numeric_limits<Dst>::is_signed
      55             :                                               ? INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED
      56             :                                               : INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
      57             :           IntegerRepresentation SrcSign = std::numeric_limits<Src>::is_signed
      58             :                                               ? INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED
      59             :                                               : INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED>
      60             : struct StaticDstRangeRelationToSrcRange;
      61             : 
      62             : // Same sign: Dst is guaranteed to contain Src only if its range is equal or
      63             : // larger.
      64             : template <typename Dst, typename Src, IntegerRepresentation Sign>
      65             : struct StaticDstRangeRelationToSrcRange<Dst, Src, Sign, Sign>
      66             : {
      67             :     static const NumericRangeRepresentation value =
      68             :         MaxExponent<Dst>::value >= MaxExponent<Src>::value ? NUMERIC_RANGE_CONTAINED
      69             :                                                            : NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED;
      70             : };
      71             : 
      72             : // Unsigned to signed: Dst is guaranteed to contain source only if its range is
      73             : // larger.
      74             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
      75             : struct StaticDstRangeRelationToSrcRange<Dst,
      76             :                                         Src,
      77             :                                         INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED,
      78             :                                         INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED>
      79             : {
      80             :     static const NumericRangeRepresentation value =
      81             :         MaxExponent<Dst>::value > MaxExponent<Src>::value ? NUMERIC_RANGE_CONTAINED
      82             :                                                           : NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED;
      83             : };
      84             : 
      85             : // Signed to unsigned: Dst cannot be statically determined to contain Src.
      86             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>

      88             :                                         Src,
      89             :                                         INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
      90             :                                         INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED>
      91             : {
      92             :     static const NumericRangeRepresentation value = NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED;
      93             : };
      94             : 
      95             : enum RangeConstraint : unsigned char
      96             : {
      97             :     RANGE_VALID     = 0x0,  // Value can be represented by the destination type.
      98             :     RANGE_UNDERFLOW = 0x1,  // Value would overflow.
      99             :     RANGE_OVERFLOW  = 0x2,  // Value would underflow.
     100             :     RANGE_INVALID   = RANGE_UNDERFLOW | RANGE_OVERFLOW  // Invalid (i.e. NaN).
     101             : };
     102             : 
     103             : // Helper function for coercing an int back to a RangeContraint.
     104             : constexpr RangeConstraint GetRangeConstraint(int integer_range_constraint)
     105             : {
     106             :     // TODO(jschuh): Once we get full C++14 support we want this
     107             :     // assert(integer_range_constraint >= RANGE_VALID &&
     108             :     //        integer_range_constraint <= RANGE_INVALID)
     109           1 :     return static_cast<RangeConstraint>(integer_range_constraint);
     110             : }
     111             : 
     112             : // This function creates a RangeConstraint from an upper and lower bound
     113             : // check by taking advantage of the fact that only NaN can be out of range in
     114             : // both directions at once.
     115           1 : constexpr inline RangeConstraint GetRangeConstraint(bool is_in_upper_bound, bool is_in_lower_bound)
     116             : {
     117             :     return GetRangeConstraint((is_in_upper_bound ? 0 : RANGE_OVERFLOW) |
     118           1 :                               (is_in_lower_bound ? 0 : RANGE_UNDERFLOW));
     119             : }
     120             : 
     121             : // The following helper template addresses a corner case in range checks for
     122             : // conversion from a floating-point type to an integral type of smaller range
     123             : // but larger precision (e.g. float -> unsigned). The problem is as follows:
     124             : //   1. Integral maximum is always one less than a power of two, so it must be
     125             : //      truncated to fit the mantissa of the floating point. The direction of
     126             : //      rounding is implementation defined, but by default it's always IEEE
     127             : //      floats, which round to nearest and thus result in a value of larger
     128             : //      magnitude than the integral value.
     129             : //      Example: float f = UINT_MAX; // f is 4294967296f but UINT_MAX
     130             : //                                   // is 4294967295u.
     131             : //   2. If the floating point value is equal to the promoted integral maximum
     132             : //      value, a range check will erroneously pass.
     133             : //      Example: (4294967296f <= 4294967295u) // This is true due to a precision
     134             : //                                            // loss in rounding up to float.
     135             : //   3. When the floating point value is then converted to an integral, the
     136             : //      resulting value is out of range for the target integral type and
     137             : //      thus is implementation defined.
     138             : //      Example: unsigned u = (float)INT_MAX; // u will typically overflow to 0.
     139             : // To fix this bug we manually truncate the maximum value when the destination
     140             : // type is an integral of larger precision than the source floating-point type,
     141             : // such that the resulting maximum is represented exactly as a floating point.
     142             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     143             : struct NarrowingRange
     144             : {
     145             :     typedef typename std::numeric_limits<Src> SrcLimits;
     146             :     typedef typename std::numeric_limits<Dst> DstLimits;
     147             :     // The following logic avoids warnings where the max function is
     148             :     // instantiated with invalid values for a bit shift (even though
     149             :     // such a function can never be called).
     150             :     static const int shift = (MaxExponent<Src>::value > MaxExponent<Dst>::value &&
     151             :                               SrcLimits::digits < DstLimits::digits &&
     152             :                               SrcLimits::is_iec559 &&
     153             :                               DstLimits::is_integer)
     154             :                                  ? (DstLimits::digits - SrcLimits::digits)
     155             :                                  : 0;
     156             : 
     157             :     static constexpr Dst max()
     158             :     {
     159             :         // We use UINTMAX_C below to avoid compiler warnings about shifting floating
     160             :         // points. Since it's a compile time calculation, it shouldn't have any
     161             :         // performance impact.
     162             :         return DstLimits::max() - static_cast<Dst>((UINTMAX_C(1) << shift) - 1);
     163             :     }
     164             : 
     165             :     static constexpr Dst min()
     166             :     {
     167             :         return std::numeric_limits<Dst>::is_iec559 ? -DstLimits::max() : DstLimits::min();
     168             :     }
     169             : };
     170             : 
     171             : template <typename Dst,
     172             :           typename Src,
     173             :           IntegerRepresentation DstSign = std::numeric_limits<Dst>::is_signed
     174             :                                               ? INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED
     175             :                                               : INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     176             :           IntegerRepresentation SrcSign = std::numeric_limits<Src>::is_signed
     177             :                                               ? INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED
     178             :                                               : INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     179             :           NumericRangeRepresentation DstRange = StaticDstRangeRelationToSrcRange<Dst, Src>::value>
     180             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl;
     181             : 
     182             : // The following templates are for ranges that must be verified at runtime. We
     183             : // split it into checks based on signedness to avoid confusing casts and
     184             : // compiler warnings on signed an unsigned comparisons.
     185             : 
     186             : // Dst range is statically determined to contain Src: Nothing to check.
     187             : template <typename Dst, typename Src, IntegerRepresentation DstSign, IntegerRepresentation SrcSign>
     188             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst, Src, DstSign, SrcSign, NUMERIC_RANGE_CONTAINED>
     189             : {
     190             :     static constexpr RangeConstraint Check(Src value) { return RANGE_VALID; }
     191             : };
     192             : 
     193             : // Signed to signed narrowing: Both the upper and lower boundaries may be
     194             : // exceeded.
     195             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     196             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst,
     197             :                                       Src,
     198             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED,
     199             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED,
     200             :                                       NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED>
     201             : {
     202             :     static constexpr RangeConstraint Check(Src value)
     203             :     {
     204             :         return GetRangeConstraint((value <= NarrowingRange<Dst, Src>::max()),
     205             :                                   (value >= NarrowingRange<Dst, Src>::min()));
     206             :     }
     207             : };
     208             : 
     209             : // Unsigned to unsigned narrowing: Only the upper boundary can be exceeded.
     210             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     211             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst,
     212             :                                       Src,
     213             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     214             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     215             :                                       NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED>
     216             : {
     217             :     static constexpr RangeConstraint Check(Src value)
     218             :     {
     219             :         return GetRangeConstraint(value <= NarrowingRange<Dst, Src>::max(), true);
     220             :     }
     221             : };
     222             : 
     223             : // Unsigned to signed: The upper boundary may be exceeded.
     224             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     225             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst,
     226             :                                       Src,
     227             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED,
     228             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     229             :                                       NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED>
     230             : {
     231             :     static constexpr RangeConstraint Check(Src value)
     232             :     {
     233             :         return sizeof(Dst) > sizeof(Src)
     234             :                    ? RANGE_VALID
     235             :                    : GetRangeConstraint(value <= static_cast<Src>(NarrowingRange<Dst, Src>::max()),
     236             :                                         true);
     237             :     }
     238             : };
     239             : 
     240             : // Signed to unsigned: The upper boundary may be exceeded for a narrower Dst,
     241             : // and any negative value exceeds the lower boundary.
     242             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     243             : struct DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst,
     244             :                                       Src,
     245             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_UNSIGNED,
     246             :                                       INTEGER_REPRESENTATION_SIGNED,
     247             :                                       NUMERIC_RANGE_NOT_CONTAINED>
     248             : {
     249             :     static constexpr RangeConstraint Check(Src value)
     250             :     {
     251             :         return (MaxExponent<Dst>::value >= MaxExponent<Src>::value)
     252             :                    ? GetRangeConstraint(true, value >= static_cast<Src>(0))
     253             :                    : GetRangeConstraint(value <= static_cast<Src>(NarrowingRange<Dst, Src>::max()),
     254             :                                         value >= static_cast<Src>(0));
     255             :     }
     256             : };
     257             : 
     258             : template <typename Dst, typename Src>
     259             : constexpr RangeConstraint DstRangeRelationToSrcRange(Src value)
     260             : {
     261             :     static_assert(std::numeric_limits<Src>::is_specialized, "Argument must be numeric.");
     262             :     static_assert(std::numeric_limits<Dst>::is_specialized, "Result must be numeric.");
     263             :     return DstRangeRelationToSrcRangeImpl<Dst, Src>::Check(value);
     264             : }
     265             :
